items.description: OpenAI releases GPT‑1, the first generative pre‑trained transformer model that sparked modern LLM development.
OpenAI announces GPT‑2, a much larger model that demonstrates advanced text generation capabilities and raises public awareness of LLM potential.
OpenAI launches GPT‑3 (175 billion parameters), demonstrating strong in‑context learning and setting new benchmarks for language models.
ChatGPT debuts as a free research preview based on GPT‑3.5, rapidly amassing millions of users and popularizing conversational interfaces.
OpenAI releases GPT‑4, an advanced model with enhanced reasoning and accuracy compared to GPT‑3.5.
Anthropic launches Claude, its conversational AI assistant designed for safer and more steerable interactions.
Meta releases Llama 2 in multiple sizes as an open‑source alternative to proprietary large language models.
Elon Musk's xAI launches Grok‑1, a 314-billion-parameter model integrated with the social platform X (formerly Twitter).
OpenAI releases GPT‑4 Turbo, a variant of GPT‑4 with improved throughput, a larger context window, and enhanced efficiency.
Google DeepMind unveils Gemini 1.5, a multimodal model with a one-million-token context window and advanced retrieval capabilities.
Google DeepMind releases advanced variants of Gemini 1.5 (commonly referred to as Gemini Ultra or Flash), featuring further optimized multimodal performance and faster inference.
OpenAI launches GPT‑4o ('Omni'), a multimodal model that processes text, images, audio, and video at twice the speed of GPT‑4 Turbo.
Anthropic releases Claude 3.5 Sonnet, featuring a 200,000-token context window and improved performance in coding and reasoning tasks.
Meta releases Llama 3.1, an advanced version with 405 billion parameters, an expanded context window, and enhanced multilingual support.
OpenAI releases GPT‑4o mini, a smaller, faster, and more cost-efficient variant that replaces GPT‑3.5 in ChatGPT's interface.
xAI launches Grok‑2, refining Grok‑1's performance and efficiency, available to premium subscribers on X.
OpenAI releases a preview of o1, a model using chain-of-thought prompting for deeper reasoning on complex tasks.
OpenAI launches the full o1 model, excelling in scientific, coding, and math tasks, available to premium ChatGPT users.
DeepSeek releases its R1 model (671B total parameters, 37B active per input) for advanced math, coding, and logical reasoning at a lower cost.
OpenAI launches o3-mini, a successor to o1-mini with advanced reasoning capabilities in a compact form.
xAI launches Grok‑3, touted as 'the smartest AI on earth,' representing the next major upgrade in the Grok series.
Techniques for compressing large transformer models into smaller, efficient variants (e.g., DistilBERT) are developed.
Research demonstrates that increasing model size, data, and compute leads to emergent capabilities—guiding the design of modern large language models.
GPT‑3 shows that models can perform tasks by conditioning on examples provided within the prompt, revolutionizing the way LLMs are utilized.

items.event: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) Introduced
items.description: RLHF is applied to fine-tune models (e.g., InstructGPT), significantly improving alignment with human expectations and reducing undesirable outputs.
The RAG approach is proposed to augment language model outputs by retrieving relevant external documents at inference time, thereby enhancing factual accuracy.
Developers quickly discover that carefully crafting prompts can greatly influence LLM outputs, establishing prompt engineering as a critical practice.
CLIP is introduced to learn joint representations for images and text, paving the way for robust multimodal applications.
Models are shown to benefit from generating intermediate reasoning steps (chain-of-thought), which significantly improves performance on complex tasks.
Stable Diffusion, an open-source text-to-image model, democratizes high-quality image generation and accelerates multimodal AI applications.

items.event: Function Calling & API-Based Tool Use Introduced
items.description: With the release of GPT‑4, OpenAI introduces built-in function calling, enabling models to interact with external APIs and tools via structured, JSON-formatted calls.

items.event: Autonomous Agents & Multi-Step Tool Use Emerge
items.description: Projects like AutoGPT and BabyAGI demonstrate that LLMs can autonomously plan and execute multi-step tasks, laying the foundation for agentic workflows and complex tool integration.
LangGraph emerges as a visual, graph-structured framework that enables developers to design, orchestrate, and debug complex LLM pipelines with ease.
Further advancements in model distillation and compression techniques enable even larger models to be deployed in resource-constrained settings while retaining performance.

items.event: Enhanced RAG with Integrated Reranking and Web Search
items.description: New RAG pipelines integrate second-stage reranking and web-search connectors to refine retrieval quality, improving the accuracy and factual grounding of generated responses.

items.event: Structured Outputs for Tool Calling Introduced
items.description: APIs from Cohere and others start supporting structured output formats (e.g., strict JSON) for tool calls and inline citations, ensuring greater reliability in multi-step RAG pipelines.

items.event: Multi-Step Tool Use and Function Calling Integrated
items.description: New models like OpenAI's o1 incorporate multi-step function calling, enabling the LLM to decide dynamically when to invoke external tools for enhanced problem solving.
The release of Cohere Rerank 3 introduces advanced reranking techniques that re-order retrieved documents by relevance, substantially boosting the precision of RAG systems.

items.event: Agentic RAG with Dynamic Knowledge Base Selection Demonstrated
items.description: A demonstration showcases an agentic RAG system that leverages Elasticsearch as a dynamic knowledge base, combined with LangChain orchestration, allowing the LLM to choose among multiple tools based on real-time context.
Research and early prototypes explore federated multi-agent RAG workflows, where multiple agents collaborate—each accessing different knowledge sources—to address complex, multi-faceted queries.
